definitions.definition: To escape, especially forcefully or defiantly.
definitions.example: The brigade succeeded in breaking out of the pocket and reunited with friendly forces.

definitions.definition: To bring out, use, or present.
definitions.example: Break out the bubbly and celebrate.
Break out the cables from the harness once they are inside the frame.

definitions.definition: To take or force out by breaking.
definitions.example: to break out a pane of glass

definitions.definition: To begin suddenly; to emerge in a certain condition.
To suddenly get pimples or a rash, especially on one's face.
(recording industry) Of a record: to achieve success.
To remove snow from a road or sidewalk.
